txt: Ako ay residente ng Metro Manila. (I am a resident of Metro Manila.)
Please ensure bike lanes are protected and biker are safe when they use them.
May bisikleta o e-scooter ako. (I own a bike or e-scooter.)
Nakakalito para sa mga driver ng kotse na makihati ng daan sa mga nagbibisikleta at naglalakad. (It’s confusing for car drivers to share the road with cyclists and pedestrians.)
Wala akng kht n ano scooter or Bike pro ung snabi n  mayor idol VICO SANG AYON AKO DYN D BEST K TLHA TALAGA MAYOR,👍
Mas mainam na may speed limit iwas aksidente
Ginagamit ng traffic enforcer ang speed limit para sa katiwalian (Speed Limits are being used as an excuse for corruption by the traffic enforcers.)
Kung walang trapik, lumalampas ako sa speed limit (If there is no traffic congestion, I drive faster than the speed limit.)
This is a good initiative. The safer the roads are, the lower the risk is for accidents and other traffic-related issues. Less pollution too
Walang sapat na mga palatandaan na nagpapakita ng speed limit sa Pasig. (There are not enough signs that display speed limits in Pasig.)
Ang mas mababang speed limit ay nagpapataas ng polusyon. (Low speed limits will increase pollution and vehicle emissions.)
Make Pasig pedestrian and bike friendly, para ma-encourage ang tao na maglakad at magbike. Yung kahit mainit at umuulan, pwede maglakad.
ok
Nagmamaneho ako ng kotse dahil hindi ligtas ang mga lugar para sa paglalakad at pagbibisikleta. (I drive due to lack of safe walking and cycling areas).
Sapat ang espasyo ng gutter para makaraan ang mga bisekleta. (There is enough space for a biker to pass if he uses the gutter.)
May kotse ako.(I own a car.)
Why is illegal parking tolerated along sixto Antonio especially during rush hours. Road signs are openly disregarded
Ang pagbibisikleta ay mabuti para sa turismo. (People riding bicycles are good for tourism)
30 kph pwede. To implement put active cctv . And traffic sign to the road that are accident prone.
Hindi safe para sa akin ang pagbibisikleta, pagmamaneho, o paglalakad sa tabi ng mabilis na takbo ng kotse (Cycling, driving, or walking next to fast moving cars makes me feel unsafe.)
I agree on 30km/hr. But 35km/hr.    would be better
we needle discipline
nothing
Intersection of Julia Vargas and ADB Ave. Please put traffic lights with countdown. The pasig enforcers prey on this area like hyenas.
Ang paglalakad at pagbibisikleta ay mas mainam para mabawasan ang trapik at polusyon. (Walking and biking offer an alternative to driving a car to help reduce congestion and pollution.)
Low speed streets are something that we do in our university and it makes our streets feel much safer than most streets.
Strict implementation of bikes only on bike lanes...Assign an enforcer to apprehend violators or install cameras..we saw jeepneys using it!
Mas komportable ang kotse kaysa sa pagbibike o paglalakad (Cars are the most comfortable mode of transportation.)
bike to work
Ito mangyayari kung ang Volume ay marami kaysa kalsada.
Ginawa ang mga kalsada para sa mga kotse lamang. (Roads were made for cars.)
At your own risk

Ang mga nagbibisikleta at naglalakad ay dapat manatili sa bike lane o sidewalk lamang para makaiwas aksidente. (Cyclists and pedestrians should stay on their part of the road only to avoid accidents.)
Nakakatakot tumawid ng daan dahil may mga sasakyan na dirediretso sa pedestrian lane at motorsiklo na bigla biglang lumilitaw
The reason of using the road is to transport people and save time. If you are to slow down movement it defeats the purpose.
Nag-bibike lang ako sa weekend. (I only bike on the weekends.)
There should be more options for publican transport.
I support this low speed limit.
that's very true ....
Ako ay residente ng Pasig City. (I am a Pasig City resident.)
It depends
30kmph should be enough for all motorists (except for those with emergencies) kasi lahat naman tayo makakarating sa patutunguhan.
Thanks
Thank you!
Hindi pwedeng 30kph kasi passthrough city ang Pasig.
Ang mga naglalakad at nagbibisikleta ay hindi dapat nasa main road. (Pedestrians and cyclists should not be on the main road.)
Sumasakay ako sa public transport upang makaikot sa lungsod. (I use public transport to get around the city.)
Kulang sa public transportation stops at pagpapatupad na sundin ito sa mga kalsada
ACCOUNTABILITY, a major factor. Look at Subic. People follow their rules. Why? because of ACCOUNTABILITY!
Ang mga bisikleta at pedestrian sa daan ay nakakadagdag sa trapik at aksidente. (The presence of bicycles and pedestrians on the road increases traffic and accidents.)
Ang pangunahing paraan ng transportasyon sa Pasig ay ang pribadong kotse. (The main mode of transportation in Pasig is by private car.)
Naiintindihan ng mga traffic enforcer ang mga regulasyon tungkol sa speed limit (Traffic enforcers understand regulation aroung speed limits)
Ang paglalakad at pagbibisikleta ay parte ng pag-cocommute ko gamit ang pampublikong transportasyon (Walking and biking complements public transport for me.)
Nahuli na ako ng enforcer ng Pasig TPMO (Traffic and Parking Management Office). (I have been apprehended by TPMO [Traffic and Parking Management Office] enforcer)
Ang mababang speed limit sa ibang kalsada ay nakakadagdag sa trapik (Low speed streets increase traffic.)
Mas matipid ang pagmamaneho ng kotse kaysa sa ibang paraan ng transportasyon. (Cars are more economical)

Kahit na malapit lang ang aking patutunguhan, pipiliin ko pa ring magmaneho ng kotse kaysa maglakad o magbisikleta. (Even though my destination is near, I still choose to drive rather than walk or bike.)
Ang speed limit ay inilaan para mapanatiling ligtas ang mga kotse, siklista at pedestrian. (Speed limits are meant to keep cars, cyclists and pedestrians safe.)
Pinapaboran ng mga traffic enforcer ay ang mga sasakyang de-motor kaysa sa mga nagbibisikleta. (Traffic enforcers favor motor vehicles over cyclists)
Pasig going to a green city is really promising and kudos to mayor for that however, I can only see it mostly in Ortigas
Dapat lng may speed limit for the safety of the people,lalo na ngayon daming nagbibisekleta at mga e-bikes na ginagamit
Madalas akong naglalakad papunta sa trabaho. (I normally walk to work.)
I think the motors can go with bike lanes..
selective  road, for the  proposed low speed 30 km kph,
I myself drive and I agree that lowering the speed limit to 30kph is fair considering the high density of both pedestrians and motorists
none
Road barriers, those two feet high posts along supposed bike lanes, are actually traffic hazards.
Hindi ko alam na may speed limit na pala sa Pasig
madalas din ako maglakad sa may amin sa labas ng valle verde para mag grocery, marami sa sidewalk puno ng nahuhulog na wire o, ihian ng tao,
Trees on slow roads should be protected as part of bike infrastructure
Sobrang bagal pag 30  gawin manlang 40
Depende po sa situation
Please cultivate discipline sa mga motor vehicles, na dapat wag sila pumasok, magsakay o magbaba ng ilegal or magpark sa bike lane.
Nakakadagdag sa trapik ang mahigpit na pagpapatupad ng speed limit sa Pasig. (Rigorous enforcement of Pasig speed limits increases traffic.)
Ang speed limit ay para lamang sa mga kotse o de-motor na sasakyan, hindi sa mga bisikleta. (Speed limits only apply to cars, not bicycles.)
Ang paglalakad at pagbibisikleta ay mabuti para sa mga business sa Pasig (Walking and biking is good for local businesses in Pasig)
I live in Pasig City. I agree.
Speed limit should be applied to all moving vehicles with respect to its speed capabilities

Mahalaga ang isang sistema ng transportasyon na nangangalaga sa mga pinaka nangangailangan ng proteksyon - mga bata, matatanda, at mga may kapansanan  (It is important to create a transport system that safeguards the most vulnerable citizens – the young, the elderly, the urban poor, and PWDs.)
Bumabagal ang pagmamaneho ko kapag malapit sa mga nagbibisikleta (I slow down when I am near cyclists)
PASIG needs to implement a motorcycle speed limit and lane. They lack discipline. 30/kmph for cars-SURE! 10/kmph for motorcycles-DEFINITELY!
Regular na ipinatutupad ang speed limit Pasig. (Pasig speed limits are enforced regularly)
I hope Pasig creates more covered pedestrian walkways.  Pasig should link all walkways.  Roof it. It's exciting to walk from Ortigas to BGC.
Thank you
No more additional statement
I'm a bike commuter. I go to work with my bike. I experienced many instances where motor vehicles exceed 30kph in a city street. Not safe.
Yes please
agree
They lead to improved traffic flow and less congestion. People can move without fear.
Agree
Kinakabahan ako kapag ang kotse, bisekleta at pedestrian ay nasa isang kalsada. (Cars, cycles and pedestrians sharing the road makes me nervous.)
Alam ko ang speed limit ng Pasig City sa mga urban area. (I am aware of Pasig City's speed limits in urban areas.)
I prefer using public transportation. However, as a woman, it is hard for me to feel safe on the streets.
I agree with this movement.
Healthier Citizens Wealthier Country
Hindi naka desenyo ang existing na daan natin para gayahin ang framework ng ibang bansa na nag bibike. Hindi rin ito economical.
I dont drive, not all people owns a car. We commute.
The bike lanes along c raymundo are too wide. PUVs used them as express lanes. Also put concrete barriers where bike lanes begin and end.
Biking and walking should have separate lanes off the road
Pag mas mababa ang speed limit, lalo akong matatagalan makarating sa patutunguhan. (Lower speed limit means that I will take longer to get to my destination.)
If so, pls make sure we have infrastructure support, and training for the traffic enforcers and widespread public info.
Lagi kong sinusunod ang speed limit. (I always follow the speed limit.)
Nawa tuloy tuloy po ang ugnayan ng mga lungsod ng Metro Manila para sa safe and bike-friendly community.
If it is safe
that may be the case if the one with the car will switch into walking and biking. else, it is moot.
To all the bikers PLEASE stay on your lane.  Mga enforcer(blueboys) paki-turo/guide po sila sa tamang lane na provided sa kanila..
Pinoys here in the Philippines does not know how to walk, how to bike, how to drive. Bring them abroad, they become experts.
Agree po on enforcing 30kmph para din naman ito sa safety ng mga tao. Pls continue to promote cycling as means of city transpo. Thank you.
Ang mga kalsada ay inilaan para sa lahat - mga naglalakad, PWD, nagbibisikleta, kotse at motorsiklo. (Roads are meant for all road users - pedestrians, PWD, cyclists, cars and motorcycles).
I hope Pasig can maintain their initiative and in the future, be replicated in the Metro Manila
Paki lagyan mo ng mga sign lalo na sa area na kung saan gusto niyong ipatupad ang speed limit.

Ang mga taong gumagamit ng kotse at iba pang mga sasakyang de-motor ay nagdudulot ng trapik, polusyon, at pagtaas ng bilang ng aksidente. (People using cars and other motor vehicles cause too much traffic, pollution, and increased accident risks.)
lagyan ng barrier ang bike lane ng sa ganun hindi makapasok ang mga sasakyan sa bike lane at hindi lumabas ng bike lane ang mga nag ba bike
Ang paglalakad at pagbisikleta ay mabuti para sa kalusugan. (Walking and biking is good for the health.)
Feeling unsafe to walk or bike on the road is largely due to the lack of infrastructure (walking bridge, bike lanes) not speed limits.
See to it that all major roads and bridges have bike lanes
Mahirap pumunta sa Pasig dahil madaming laartehan sa kalsada. Di ito nakaka hikayat sa negosyo at komersyo.
I drive slowly, it depends on the road or small street to prevent major accidents  and protect the pedestrians.
yes
Kailangan ko ng karagdagang impormasyon tungkol sa speed limit sa Pasig (I need more information about speed limits in Pasig)
To catch and extort?
Mas gusto ko ng kotse kaysa bike kasi ito ang pinakamabilis na paraan upang maabot ang aking patutunguhan. (Cars are the fastest way to reach my destination.)
I hate smoke belching tricycles and jeepneys I hope they can do something to remove them from the streets of Pasig.
At times, hindi ito ang nangyayari dahil sinasakop pa din po ng mga motor vehicles ang bike lane kaya hindi nagiging sapat ito.
cant really see any signs.
Im done po
NCR is not a tourist spot. You use bike in NCR to go to work or for errands.
Depends on the discipline
I agree that city driving speed should be limited and regulated. Other modes of sustainable transportation should also be encouraged.
This will help our citizens
I think they need to be trained and educated more
Low speed street is a must.
Dependa if there is a bike like i feel safe
We need to encourage more walking and biking and lesser dependency on private cars.
Electric vehicles that are not categorized either as bicycle or motorcycle should only use the bicycle lane. They do not hav drivers license
30kph? Di hindi ka nga maka andar ng 5kph. 30 pa kaya. Bike lane. Liit na nga ng kalsada papaliitin pa. Ihiwalay nyo sa main road
If it reduces the frequency and severity of accidents for both motorists and pedestrians, then by all means, do it.
I. Like to support the government of Pasig on this project
the universal cause, no roads are made for people. but here in the Ph, it was made for cars.
Bikes are fast if may maayos at ligtas na lane for them cars are supposed to be for long distance travel
Yes
We need protected bike lanes now. Araw-araw ilegal na pumapasok ang mga motor vehicle dito, nagsasakay o nagbababa at pumaparada sa loob.
Lower speed limit without traffic will get you to ur job just the same with higher speed limit and traffic
Dapat lang ipatupad ang tamang speed limit lalo na sa maliliit at mataong kalsada. Mas mababawasan ang aksidente at mas ligtas sa karamihan.
30 kph below makes our streets safe. Enforce speed limit to all motorized vehicles asap!
Disagree..
I think it's a good idea considering how often accidents happen on Philippine roads due to speeding, even on pedestrian lanes.
lol
Thanks!
mas okay kung maramiung public transpo
Thank you! Please make streets safer for pedestrians and cyclists ~ those are the better alternatives
I think its the improper driving habits and the mortorist, singit dito singit doon and mga kung ano ano na nakaharang sa daan
Most roads /streets in Metro Manila were designed by engineers without consulting urban planners and transport experts.
all depends on discipline of the person driving and using the public transportation. And cleanliness and security of the public transport
This will help the health of our citizens
I accompanied my wife this morning going to her workplace in pasig from quezon city on bike para turoan sya sa mga safe na route.
Bike lanes must be exclusive to bikes only period!
For as long as there are clear traffic rules and sufficient spaces for pedestrians, bikes, i think cars, people, cycles can all co-exist.
I am for creating a safe space for walking and cycling. I also hope that the skating community we will considered in this decision making
